thread.title: Watch: Hockey player scores goal with opponent's stick
thread.title_full: Watch: Hockey player scores goal with opponent's stick

title: Watch: Hockey player scores goal with opponent's stick
text:
Manage Watch: Hockey player scores goal with opponent's stick Dylan Strome of the Erie (Pa.) Otters of the Ontario Hockey League had his stick taken out of his hands by London Knights defenseman Brandon Crawley after Crawley 
Dylan Strome of the Erie (Pa.) Otters of the Ontario Hockey League had his stick taken out of his hands by London Knights defenseman Brandon Crawley after Crawley lost his stick in a collision. 
Not to be deterred, Strome skated over and picked up Crawley's stick and continued the play. 
Strome got the puck, skated in front of the next and scored a goal on a give-and-go to put the Otters up 5-1 in the third period. 
After the goal, Strome held Crawley's stick high in the air in a sort of salute. Then he skated over to the Knights' bench and he and Crawley exchanged sticks. 
Hopefully Crawley has learned his lesson.
